Name: Mesoscale whole-brain T2*-weighted and associated quantitative MRI in humans at 10.5 T
ReferencesAndLinks: Custom built workflow for data processing
Acknowledgements:
The authors would like to honor and remember Pierre-Francois Van de Moortele for his invaluable contributions to the development of ultrahigh field MRI and the 10.5 T MRI. The authors would like to thank Michael Garwood and Yicun Wang for insightful discussion and acknowledge Jerahmie Radder, Scott Lynch, and Carlos Soria for their assistance with setting up computation resources. This work was supported in part by Hamon Foundation, Texas Instrument Foundation, NIH grants (R01 NS136490, P41 EB027061, U01 EB025144, and S10
RR029672), and the intramural research program of the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke at NIH.
EthicsApprovals: This study is approved by local IRB at the University of Minnesota
